intro: Nototriche vargasii, commonly known as the Vargas nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Nototriche vargasii is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cooler, high-altitude environments.
